history.content: Similar question here. I'm pretty confident that I can declare the major for my CS GPA is 4.0, but I've seen posts saying that people who are going to declare this semester are also NOT allowed to waitlist for Upper Divs for phase I, while others say they purge waitlist only after processing major declarations. Any clarifications? @Admin

children.subject: Anon, that's not what the answer field is for. But this is post is actually resolved anyway since there was a post this morning by Michael explicitly saying people declaring this semester should NOT waitlist in phase I as they will be purged. This makes sense if you think about it since phase II starts before this semester is finished (as opposed to fall semester's enrollment).

history.content:
Hello, I'm a Junior who is declaring this semester. I'm pretty confident I will meet the GPA threshold, but have a waitlist question I have not seen answered yet or on the eecs policies: 
Will I be able to enroll/waitlist myself to upper division classes in phase I if I am declaring this semester? And if the system lets me, is it actually allowed, or just a bug (and waste of waitlist units)?

I heard this was buggy last semester, and people who should not have been able to do so were allowed by the new SIS anyway. I have also heard that people in my situation have been allowed to waitlist, and then after major applications were processed in June, people who do not meet the gpa threshold are purged when phase II starts, but everyone who was declaring was able to waitlist in phase I, just as if they were already declared.

P.S. I am able to enroll/waitlist 20.5 units in my phase I, and plan on taking 15-16 units, so strategic allocation of units is a non-issue for me.
history.subject: Upper Divs / Declaring This Semester
